article.headline: Marshall 59, Virginia Tech 58
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (AP) -- Mark Dorris scored 20 points to lead Marshall to a 59-58 upset of Virginia Tech on Saturday. Marshall (4-8) built 38-17 lead in the first half, then held on for the win. Dorris scored 17 in the opening half, including three 3-pointers. Virginia Tech (9-4) mounted a comeback in the second half. The Hokies went on a 22-12 run after the break and took the lead 56-55 with less than two minutes to play. Marshall regained a 57-56 advantage and with 16 seconds to play, Tre Whitted sank a pair of free throws to stretch the advantage to three. Virginia Tech cut the deficit to 59-58, but with five seconds to play Zabian Dowdell's last-chance shot was deflected by Marshall's Jean Francois Bro-Grebe. Dowdell scored 17 to lead Virginia Tech.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
